name:
Waiting is never good when you are in the line, though you would appreciate the made to order no rush service.
Pizza crust was what made it for us.  It was good regardless of the toppings.

Went here late on a Sunday when everywhere else seemed closed - only had takeaway but the staff were very friendly, the service was quick and the pizzas tasted fantastic.  Everything made from scratch and with really tasty fresh ingredients.  Would happily go back!

We were in town on vacation and staying about 5 blocks away. We had gone to another restaurant in the meat packing district the night before and saw how popular mother was so we went back! We had the fried cod appetizer and two pizzas....More
Pizza was good, but service was not very nice and the wait... god ! you cant run a restaurant kitchen with just one oven ?!

It was super busy the night we rocked up - anopera event was on and everywhere was packed. The waiter kindly installed us in the bar, and then came to get us when a table was ready. He was polite and friendly throughout and even...More

Pizza was delish, in a laid-back atmosphere with good food and friendly staff. We tried two types of pizza and the grown-ups also enjoyed our cocktails (aperol spritz). We arrived early for dinner (before 5pm, as the kids were exhausted), but there was a queue...More

This is listed by many articles as the best pizza in Copenhagen which seems to be a ibt of an exaggeration. It is good but nothing special. We were there on a Saturday evening and had a table outside. The tables outside are extremely small...More

I’ve had a reservation at 20:30, which I reckon is a busy time for the restaurant, because the food, the drinks and overall the service was extremely slow. 
The antipasti and the pizza were good quality and tasty, but the atmosphere was destroyed by the...More

“THIS is MY RESTAURANT and I will run it HOW I WANT”

That’s what the owner screamed at us when we meekly suggested that we had waited 1+ hour for a pizza.  Disgusting customer service.

Refused to apologise or indeed accept anything was wrong with...More

Dined at Mother's twice... Margharita pizza the first night and pizza with smoked salmon second night.  Traditional was the best.  Loved the pizza, the people watching including the chefs and servers, met interesting people also enjoying good pizza,,

Arrived and waited at bar for table. Pizza was among the best we've had. Quirky location and seating style as the tables spill out onto the street - small groups may have to share tables with others. Friendly and fast service, would definitely recommend -...More

Went here one evening for drinks and a meal it was recommended by one of the waiters in our hotel we sat outside it was a very nice evening we waited for some service and waited asked three different waiters could we have a drink...More

I have been to this restaurant two years ago and had the best experience...so when I brought my friend...I thought it would be the same. Turns out they have new owners and you can so tell with the experience we had. 

I had two waiters...More
We had a Saturday brunch and it was just great. All the different kinds of dishes were available. Tasty food and friendly customer service!
Insolent waiters who seem to think customers should be grateful for the privilege of waiting a really, really long time to eat mediocre, stone-cold pizza.

Our hotel was near the Kodbyen neighborhood of Copenhagen- the meatpacking district that has been converted into restaurant row with a selection of cuisines to suite many tastes. We had previously eaten at Warpigs, and returned to this area during our last night in Denmark...More

From our hotel near the train station this is an easy walk.  However, between the train station and this restaurant you pass an area of open drug and alcohol abuse. There was a big police presence while we were there, so it was tolerable.  Then...More
Had a great time eating pizza and drinking beer. We got a table but the table wasnt suitable for wheelchairs, but the pizza and service wad top.

We visited the restaurant in the middle of June 2019 for brunch. The table was reserved beforehand. The brunch, including the pizzas, was very good, and the orchestra played outside (continuing inside when the thunderstorm started). The atmosphere was lovely. The only minus was when...More

We got I think the rudeness waiter.. answering in a really bad way and making us feeling uncomfortable. The pizza was regular.. the mozzarella was a real Italian mozzarella or a cheap cheese? And at the end they get even upset because we were leaving...More
This was a great little find in the Meat packing district. Great indoor and outdoor place. The pizza was fresh and I also recommend the meat and cheese board.

This place looks like a place you want to go to...long line suggesting it must be good, wood fired pizzas, and indoor and outdoor seating. But, beware! We waited a bit for a table which we did willingly since we hopped into line behind several...More
Over in the Meat packing area we discovered this restaurant. Very fresh ingredients served with a smile, really great pizzas. We even met the boss who wanted to chat about the business with us!

Lovely pizza, v tasty and just perfect. Attentive Service was good considering how busy it was (Sat night peak time). Good value as well, and very local to our hotel(!) what’s not to like! Would really recommend but patience is needed as it is really...More

We went on a Friday evening and the place was packed. So we had to wait for an hour to get our pizza, which was OK because everyone in the open kitchen was working hard. I can't complain with the service like I read in...More
We had a table for 4 on a busy sunny Sunday night and enjoyed great food and really good service. Seems to be very popular with Copenhagen locals, tasty food, nice beers and buzzing atmosphere.
we ordweed 3 pizzas at 19.00 got our order at 20.20 waited more than an hour. Really bad service. Every time we asked they sad 10 min more

We waited 100 mins and the waitress did not apologize. And when the pizza finally came,one of our pizzas were cold , and again no apology. And when we finally left , the waitress did not apologize or give us a discount. Worst staff i...More

This is a great place for pizza. I went on my first night in Copenhagen and I loved the pizza. If you’re not a big eater, I’d recommend one to share. 

If you’re planning on going, I’d avoid peak times, it took over an hour...More

We arrived in Copenhagen after 9 pm on a Tuesday and we were worried about finding somewhere to eat. Our hotel suggested a stroll to the meatpacking district. We walked by Mother and they were still serving at close to 10 pm so we sat...More

During my meal last night, I saw the manager/owner speaking aggressively with a waiter including physically grabbing his wrists and shoulder. The staff member was clearly intimidated, backing away during the conversation. I raised this with the manager before we left – she made no...More

Perhaps our party of 9 were unlucky this sunny May day, but the pizzas disappointed everyone greatly. They were without a lot of taste when we finally got them after asking several times.
The service from the staff was unprofessional but friendly, except from the...More
Went to Sunday brunch, had salad, pie and pizza. Everything was really good and the venue is very hip and cool. It was just extremely hot inside, sun was in our faces and maybe they don’t have AC.

The pizza here is freshly made and they have a great selection of toppings and sides. It was very nice t sit outside in nice weather and have a few beers with friends. Nice and accessible for my wheelchair.
We shared a pizza because we weren't very hungry, and it was plenty. Would have loved to try another.

Lovely pizza, wine and outdoor seating. Even had heaters for when the sun was setting and it got chilly. Could tell everything was fresh! A little pricey for what I would normally pay for good pizza but everything is more expensive in Copenhagen. Highly recommend...More
Nice, cosi place in the Vesterbro neighborhood of Copenhagen. Great Italian pizza! The cocktails looked nice too, although we had wine. Recommended!
Nice place to go with groups, but usually very busy. Pizzas are really big, worth sharing between people to try as many as possible.

The reason for 4 not 5 is due to how packed in we were, that's part of the atmosphere I suppose but it was a little too tight for us.

That aside, the pizzas are great, it's quite open plan so that you can see...More

Very slow. We were seated and then it seemed like they forgot about us. We had to ask for a waiter so we could order. Busy but not packed so I can’t imagine the service on a night where they are seating outside also! 
Pizza...More

I've had lunch at this place, and the food was good. Not spectacular, but good. However, the take-away pizza shop up the road is better.
I came back for dinner: Terrible! Hated it! Can't talk about the quality of the food though. The staff was...More

Showed up without a reservation, was lucky to get a seat outside. We had to wait a while for the menu and the drinks menu and then some more waiting to get the waiter's attention. We ordered a bottle of the house rosé and two...More

We were a group of 7, ordered many different pies and were quite happy with our pizza!
Service was excellent

The place is cute, despretentious and with a familiar vibe. The pizzas are good and well served. The burrata was also very good. It was packed when we get there but fortunately we had made a reservation. It's a bit confuse to try to be...More

I can only comment on the service as we had to leave before getting close to ordering anything.

We arrived about 8pm, waited in a short queue outside and were told the kitchen was behind as it was busy, so we would have to stay...More

Don't know what everyone's moaning about. The place was very busy- because the pizza is fantastic !! - excellent sourdough base and very fresh tasty toppings. One of the best we've had ( including Italy) Yes the tables are close together- yes we had a...More

Despite a nice place, all the waiters are under the hard control of the manager who is really unfriendly. It’s not a restaurant but a factory for tourists.
However the pizza were quite good.

I've enjoyed Mother in the 4 years I've been in Denmark.  In the past year, it has changed and not at all in a good way.  The pizza is still decent especially if they can serve it hot.  But the service needs a lot of...More
Didn’t think it was possible, living in NYC where we have the best pizza, but the pizza was amazing. Service slow.

I came to Copenhagen with a friend back in October and then again this weekend just gone. Both times the result was the same - good pizza but a team of staff that looked like they'd been reading Nietzsche all afternoon before their shift and...More

The pizza here was absolutely amazing! I had the salamina pizza and loved it. If you like wine, have the red wine that Mother makes - so good! The only thing that I didn’t like was how crazy hot the restaurant was - definitely was...More

Wonderful pizzas for Copenhagen ,
Nice place , in and out.
Service a bit slow , not always attentive.

Waitresses more keen on gossips than clients

A cool bar spread across three floors, offering some limited wine tasting with fresh buffet style hot and cold nibble food and a great location to talk and hear some sax and double bass. Quite pricey at 950 DDK for a few glasses and food...More

Our group of four tried 3 different pizzas on a Sunday night. The pizza was great, but the service was really slow. Our server was pleasant, but she was working way too many tables. 

4.5 stars for the food. 2 stars for the service.

This is a very busy pizza restaurant in the meatpacking district. We put our name down for a table and returned an hour later where we had a drink in the bar until our table was ready. It is a crowded place with tables close...More

Really lousy experience! Went to "Mother" on a company outing. Turned out that we only had the table for two hours, which I guess would have been fine if they hadn't waited a full hour bringing the food. At the two-hour mark - with coffee...More

Jumped in to this place to escape the rain and glad we did. Place was packed for a mid-week night but we were given a table quickly. Pizza was good as were the wine options and all served by very friendly staff.

quality of the pizza is not anymore at the same level.
After 6 years quality of the pizza and experience itself you can live at Mother changed a lot.
I won't chose it anymore.

Deliciouspizza here for dinner. The palce was absolultly packed (Thursday evening) and we were squeezed into a table but the food was well worth the slight inconvenience. Not sure you can book but that might be a better idea than just turn up as we...More

I’ve been there for two todays and both days I’ve had a horrible service. The most rude girl in life it’s the hostess. She ignored me and tried to put me in a table together with strangers but the restaurant was empty. When I asked...More

We ordered two pizzas. Both were delicious. The service was very good. The only problem was they we seated near a big fridge (the door was continuously opened and closed by the personnel that was not very convenient)

Celebrating our daughters birthday was a mixed experience. Doing dinner at Mothers in Koedbyen, which was very full of people and noisy but that’s how it is. Waiters were not a 100% up to speed forgetting stuff and comming later. The antipasto was good selection...More
Excellent pizza, well worth a visit. Lovely fresh ingredients. Busy atmosphere, clearly a popular choice.

Not having made a booking we had a small wait while enjoying Aperol Spritz at the bar. Once seated we were served efficiently and our sourdough pizzas came quickly even though the restaurant was heaving.
Delicious well topped pizzas, with a lovely crust were most...More

I visited Mother with a friend of mine. The place is usually very busy, so I recommend  booking a table, if you don't want to wait for a long time. The atmosphere was really nice there, it is a nice looking restaurant. We both enjoyed...More
Cozy place, very popular. We share a pizza with couple of glass of wine and turamitsu and choco fondant cake. Total came to 360 Cronw, good price for Copanhagen

This pizzeria has a great atmosphere and the pizza is very yummy. However, having ordered a vegetarian pizza for around £20 I found a fairly large piece of beef on it - I therefore told a waitress who sympathised being vegetarian herself and was genuinely...More

We stumbled across this place on the first night that we were in Copenhagen. It was bustling by 6pm. We hadn't booked but they got us a table within 5 mins (I think we were quite lucky and would recommend booking). We had an antipasti...More
Average pizza and service. The prices are ok by Copenhagen standards but it’s all a bit bland. It was very busy but I don’t understand why.

I went to this restaurant last night with a friend. I do not eat bread so understood that my options were somewhat limited. I initially decided to order a dish with cheese and rice which was a starter, I spoke to the waiter who advised...More

When we arrived we asked for a table of 4, not having booked. The restaurant was half empty and the manager sat us at a small table by the fridge. We then went ahead and swapped tables to a larger one next to it. The...More

We got pizzas and they erre was very good although a bit pricy but the service was quite poor. We waited around 30 minutes for a table - which is fine considered we didn't booked beforehand on a Saturday night. But then another 20 minutes...More
Years ago I went to this restaurant. So I was happy that Mother is close to our hotel. We shared pizzas to try different ones. It’s very good and tasty. My favourite is the burrata pizza.

Does this restaurant serve the worlds best pizza? At least it's very close..! The restaurant is a little "rough" located in Kødbyen in Copenhagen. But don't let that fool you - the service is nice and polite - and if they deliver out of the...More
The pizzas are so tasty and overwhelming that this is a top Pick place to go for pizza and very Well situated in the meatpacking district

Cozy atmosphere near the brick oven.  Fun to watch our pizza being made.  I would definitely recommend order you own pizza rather than sharing due to portion size.  I got the prosciutto pesto pizza which was good but could use a bit of salt and...More

Pizza was ok - no more. After eating we wanted to stay and have another glass of wine, but were asked to vacate the table to make room for a new round of (more profitable) customers. So I guess it is ok for a quick...More
This is located in a vibrant, hip area (an old meat packing district).  The pizza was really good.  One pizza is big enough for two or three people.

We were two people, we had reserved a table so no wait :)

we were taken into the back and let me tell you the tables in this resturant is so packed that there is max 10 cm space between the tables making it impossible...More

We were staying near the Meat District and decided to check out Mother after hearing good reviews.  We were not disassociated.  Great pizza and good cocktails.  Welcoming owner/manager and attentive service.  Would definitely recommend!

The Pizza was nice, but the service was confused and chaotic.

Wine from one person, pizza from another, water from another, confused looks from another.

I would recommend visiting for the food- but don't forget to tell them to get themselves in order if you...More

We decided to stop in to this restaurant since it looked crowded and that is usually a good sign...  Restaurant is very nice and cocy since ity is an old industrial (meat factory?) building and you can still feel the history. Pizzas were good but...More

Vent there with my wife, on a Thursday and ordered a veggie pizza without cheese. The restaurant was busy and the staff was running around like crazy. We were served by 4 different people, which was confusing. The pizza I ordered, did not reach my...More

Quite possibly the worst service I have ever experienced. The host greeting people is incredibly rude and ignored us on many occasions, greeting others before speaking to us. We were then seated without a menu, and waited a further 10 minutes to receive this and...More
We stopped here for lunch, and it was fantastic, almost like being in Italy!  Food, service, and atmosphere were all terrific.

I loved the vibe of this place. I visited in August and sat outside in the sun with my sister and enjoy wine , olives and more wine. It was cool, great service and I’d love to eat there next time as the food looked...More
This place definitely serves the best pizza in Copenhagen! Delicious sourdough base, perfectly thin, crispy edges and delicious toppings!

Just back from 2 nights in Copenhagen and we ate in Mother both nights as it is hard to fault it. Pizzas are delicious, reasonably priced and the ingredients are unbelievably fresh.
Probably one of the nicest woodfired pizzas that I've ever had. The general...More

We had a great time at Mother. The pizza was delicious; fresh toppings and crispy base. Bogdan was very friendly,  great banter and gave us great recommendations for the rest of the night. Would recommend 😃

Had to wait to get a table, but that is a good thing. Orderer pizza to main course and it was amazing. Only complaint i had was that the waitress was hard to get a hold on. Wanted dessert, but ended up just paying and...More

Hugely disappointing meal after being recommended this restaurant. All three pizzas were completely raw in the middle and inedible. We had to scrape of the toppings and eat those instead. When we complained to the manager Bogdan, he was completely unsympathetic and aggressive towards our...More

Too long time to order, too long time to get the 2 pizzas after the bruschettas (instead of "ricotta and 'nduja", write better "ricotta with bread and a spot of'nduja"). When I went to ask for the pizzas because it was late for us, I...More
My friend recommended this place and he was not wrong. Fun atmosphere, great pizza, and the house red wine good. Wish they took cash, but that is ok.

the pizza was not good in terms of taste. the ground was black from below but still not through.
Gnocci was ok.

Lovely restaurant and atmosphere. 
Pleasant service and front of house.
Food was delicious and filling. Moderate prices, but reasonable compared to standard prices here.

Fun location in the meatpacking district and the restaurant with adjoining bar were really buzzing and lively even mid-week. The pizza was great and starters (fried salted cod and rice balls/arancini) really tasty. Also found the service friendly even though they were rushed off their...More

were guests at MOTHER in september 2018, just the day before the copenhagen half marathon.

food, ambiance, team: great.

but please don't let your guests sit on tables just in front of the "cold-storage room", where your cooks are going in-and-out every 5 minutes.
i...More

My friend and i were waiting for our food for 45 minutes and i asked the waitress how long we could expect to wait further and she came back and said it was on its way. After 10 more minutes she came with the pizzas...More

I love Pizza, I love Copenhagen, and I love the meat packing district as well! Sitting outside on a summer day at Mother is an experience worthwhile. The service is good, the drinks are fine (not the most extensive beer list, but some solid wines),...More

Delicious brunch with amazing variety of pizzas and other buffet items. Having enquired about whether there are vegetarian pizzas around, the restaurant staff was super considerate, quick and rather proactively ordered for a massive portion of vegetarian pizzas as part of their buffet. Other than...More

Delicious brick oven sourdough pizza.  Fresh ingredients, good selection of pre-designed pizzas.  Very popular local restaurant.  Lots of indoor and outdoor seating.  Service was a little slow due to large crowd of people.  Overall great experience and food.

We stopped in for pizza on a Friday, having just arrived in the city centre. We walked around the meat packing area to check out a lot of restaurants and were lucky to get a table at Mother without a wait. The staff were friendly,...More

Very bad service, booked table for 10 people and arrived on time but no coordination by the restaurant (table not ready). Quality of food not as good as 1 year ago. Fewer fructs purposed, tomato and mozzarella not renewed for customer. In general we don't...More

We made a stopover at Mother every single day of our stay in CPH. Located at the must-visit Meat Packing district, the restaurant is luminous, comfortable and clean, you can see how food is prepared and everything looks and tastes so fresh and homemade. Besides...More

We went on a Friday evening, it was packed and we had to wait to share a table. We ordered one beer, one tap water, an appetiser to share and a pizza to share.  The food was average at best and the price was staggering....More

Very cool shabby industrial chic venue with lots of hipster ambiance. Draft craft beers and wide range of wines and other beverages. Was really busy about 8.00 but quite quickly seated and took order. First round of drinks ok. Bruschetta was really just a very...More

I was here a week ago while on a business trip. Remembered the restaurant from a few years back as being very good and always very crowded.
It was still very crowded but it was not as good as before anymore. The host at the...More
Excellent pizza, not surprisingly. The fried cod appetizer is also very good, as is the burrata. The appetizer servings are comically small, so be prepared for that.

We had dinner at the Mother which was a 5 minute walk from Hotel Tiffany.  It was filled to capacity, but the host got us a table on no time.  It is most famous for its Pizzas which looked awesome but we were in a...More
Very very popular pizza restaurant with long waits for a table. Once seated, the service was poor, had to ask for menus, starters and pizza arrived together. The pizza was average.

The ambient is actually my favorite part of this place. The food was very good, yet it was a bit more expensive. I like the area where the restaurant is situated. I would recommend this place for everyone who would like to eat a good...More

We visited in august for dinner around 5.30pm. The service was good but 1 of the waitresses was rather miserable. 
The pizzas are good and lots of choice.  The veggie one was really tasty. 
Over £100 for a family of 4, which in my opinion...More

Good concept, agreeable pizza for Denmark but having to wait for an hour for food at a pricy pizzeria is not ok for a Tuesday evening. Most of the staff are young kids from Eastern Europe pretending to be Italian - up’s the quality of...More

Outstanding and reasonably priced red wine selection! Awesome pizzas! Artichokes, anchovies.... all our favorite toppings, and a basic margarita or vegetarian if you want something easy. They take visa :) friendly staff and awesome meal in trendy area of town!

Me and my family had Pizza last week. I travel a lot internationally, I must say this is 
a goo 98% italian neoplitan style pizza. They use good raw materials. Good choice for wine as well.

Pizza here was excellent. The table sharing outside was lots of fun for us- not optional it seemed! But allows for more interaction with locals. Funny spot down a blue and white alley, but everything was delicious and friendly staff.

Found this place whilst on a bike trip around the city and we’d seen it advertised. Mother is in a very hip area of Copenhagen and is surrounded by other cool restaurants. We arrived and Sunday is brunch which was ok but maybe a little...More

We came to Mother wednesday evening, where they weren't so busy and got a table straight away. First thing I was very surprised about was the prices - they are really really high, but OK, we have paid more than 20 Euro for a pizza...More

The pizza here is excellent and the staff are very friendly. On a very busy evening we waited over an hour for our pizza. Other people came after us and had ordered and eaten before we had been served. As we were with children and...More

We love visiting Mother for its fantastic pizzas when we come to Copenhagen.  The restaurant is always busy so booking ahead is important.  Space is at a premium so be prepared to squeeze around a table. The bruschetta is excellent and the pizzas are fantastic...More

Arrived at 6pm with our young children (7,10). We sat outside and had bruschetta (delicious), prosciutto (delicious), three pizzas (over ordered). Service was great. Italian style pizza very good. I only wish there were more entree options than pizza. Otherwise, delicious family friendly place.

The pizza was of great quality. The place was beyond crowded and we had to wait 50 minutes for our pizzas, which was expectable considering the crowd. Although tasty, my pizza was by no means warm. Overall a good experience, even considering the pricy pizzas.

Recommended by our Airbnb host as best brunch in area.  Pricey so go hungry and you can fill up on various pizza, meats and cheeses, pastries, fruit.  Coffee is extra; probably didn't need to order that second cup.

We were early on a sunday and therefore got a place pretty easy. We both ordered The classic margarita and really liked the pizza. The sourdough was tasty. Service was fast and friendly. The restaurant itself is pretty stylish.

Ordered the marinara pizza, did not enjoy it.  The sauce was flavorless.  My girlfriend ordered the same and loved it.  Take from that what you will.

The service was good despite the restaurant being very busy, and they have a nice choice of draft beers.

We were seated almost immediately, inside, on a very hot evening.  The outside tables were all taken.  I was disappointed that there was no salad on the menu.  I always like to have a salad before/with pizza.  Anyway, we ordered our pizzas and we waited,...More
Most boring and tasteless pizza I’ve had for years. At the same time the most expensive I've ever had! Also my colleague was very disappointed by his pizza. Never again!
Located in the Meat Packing District, this place was an excellent find!  The food was wonderful, the staff was great!  Would highly recommend foccaccia for starters!

This is a trendy pizza place in the meat packing district.  Wood fired pizza ovens, good makers, inside and outside eating, share tables outside,  we had buffalata w/ sun dried tomatoes - very nice, one P.O. Ella pizza - sausage was great - pizza cooked...More

Heard this was the best pizza in Copenhagen - if it is, pizza here must be average! It was very soggy and not overloaded with flavour. Pizzas here were €20+. The meatpacking area was slightly underwhelming - more of a giant car park with little...More

I came upon Mother on my first day in Copenhagen. It was a warm day, I was hungry, and wasn't sure what I wanted. I found myself in the Meatpacking District and the sign outside Mother lured me in.

The service was wonderful and the...More

The pizza is simply delicious.
I love the pizza quattro fromaggi with tomato sauce. 
This place serves it as a white pizza but, believe me, the consistance of the bread and the combination of different cheeses makes up for everything.  (I'm italian, I've been eating...More
Found the brushcheta portion a tad bit tiny - ONE piece 😂 ... the pizza was yum ... went for a quick bite after a long day of sightseeing. Enjoyed the outdoor vibe with the music.
Delicious pizza in a convenient location. We shared a pizza and a veggie platter and it was just the right amount of food. Tables are close together, but it adds to the party atmosphere.

We called in here just before 12 am and thought we would just have a quick snack but on seeing the food coming out we decided to have a meal.Great pizzas and excellent wines.Ended walking out of here very satisfied.Well worth the cost..,
This place has become a favourite of ours in the summer time. They serve excellent pizzas, decent wine at fair prices and the waiters are really friendly. A perfect place to spend summer evenings.

Heard about this place and just fell into it.  Outside seating on a beautiful night was so enjoyable.  So many different kinds of pizza, it was almost hard to choose.   We had a vegetarian and one with buffalo mozzarella.  Both were very tasty.

Mother is highly rated as one of the best places for pizza in Copenhagen and is located in old meat packing district which is a quieter area of the city. I chose the Prosciutto pizza which came with lots of ham and pesto and was...More

Had a lunch there! Great atmosphere, great staff and service, great food! Worth to pay a visit and enjoy the time - you can have a vegetarian food without problem. Nice surroundings. I enjoyed your time there!

Its a vibrant hood Kødbyen, packed with happy people and a good vibe. Mothers terrace is Busy, but I do Get a table and a quick service. I choose a pizza (the marinara) and a wine (a Barbera), so far so good. But: The pizza...More

I have been to Mother many times and I never get tired of it! It is the only place where I eat all the crust because it is so good!
Fair warning - wait time for tables is very long, so if you are in...More

We were there in a large family group on a Friday night. Food and service were OK and yes the City was very busy that night but the number of toilets for the venue just wasn't acceptable and having the maitre d shout at people...More

We visited after a full day of sight seeing so we were more than ready for our pizzas. The restaurant is very casual with plenty of outside eating. The kitchen is open which is always great to see. 
The menu is fairly small but this...More

We came, a group of 8, on a Friday evening, and the place was filled up. Since it was a warm day, we couldn't sit indoors, so we had to wait 30-40 minutes to get a table. Right next to the loudspeakers, who played VERY...More

I visit this place 2-3 times a year! Its in the hyped mestpacking district. Do yourself a favor and make a reservation or else you can wait a hour to be seated. Compared to other italian restaurants this has a basic pizza menu and not...More

This is a bustling little place that serves fantastic sourdough pizzas and also makes a great location for an early evening drink in the summer. Others reviewers have commented on the service being slow, however we found the speed of service reasonable. Would recommend for...More

The food is tasty, but this is where the good experience ends. The service is really slow, we waited for more than an hour for the pizzas that were supposed to arrive within 35 minutes, and up to half hour for drinks. The greeter was...More
We have had a great brunch at Mothers last week! Very good and healthy food. And very pleasant to enjoy brunch outside

Mother is a wonderful place to have delicious pizza and feel the Copenhagen pulse. The place is normally crowded and busy, but the atmosphere is nevertheless good and relaxed. The menu is varied, but I struggle to choose anything else than the Moo!, as it...More

I wish I could rate this restaurant zero stars, one star is too much of a compliment to this place. Me and my family had enjoyed a lovely stay in Copenhagen and we came to Mother for our final night which was a huge regret,...More
As usual the food was good. I was bit surprised of the buffala extra charges. I went to this place after almost two years and felt 75 DKK for buffala was a bit pricey! Otherwise good.

My gal pal and I were staying a couple of blocks away and decided to give this place a shot! We arrived around 7:30pm on a weekday evening and waited about 45 minutes for a table. It was a tad chilly outside so the host/manager...More
Great pizza, but nothing else on the menu available apart from pizza and drinks - I think because it is Sunday. Good atmosphere though and nice to sit outside.

Good prices for Copenhagen (pizza is always relatively cheap). Nice location in the old meatpacking district - Copenhagen just oozes cool. The beer was decent and the service was also amazing. Great evening with good pizza.

Had a nice group dinner with friends from work! We called in advance since we were around 12 in order to assure a big table, the restaurant had everything ready and nicely set up! We had pre-ordered appetizers (house recommendation) which all were very good...More

Mother is situated in the meatpacking district of Copenhagen. A very stylish venue and the restaurant itself is really simple and cool!
We had the best pizzas I’ve ever eaten in my life! These guys did really a great job. Good service and nice employees....More

We went there with our 3 year old daughter. The staff is kind, the food is fresh and well made and we had a fantastic wine (Montepulciano, Tolosa 07). The tables are made of wood, you sit on a bench, so it's very rustic and...More

Much hyped in Copenhagen at least, the restaurant was all booked this evening. If the weather is good, find yourself a seat outside, where you can expect to share the table with other customers. The pizzas are made with a special kind of sour dough...More

We went on a Tuesday night at 7pm and it was really full with queues-- so make sure you book a table. The restaurant is located about 15 mins walk out of the city from the Central station-- in the old meat packing area which...More

Waiting is never good when you are in the line, though you would appreciate the made to order no rush service.
Pizza crust was what made it for us.  It was good regardless of the toppings.

Went here late on a Sunday when everywhere else seemed closed - only had takeaway but the staff were very friendly, the service was quick and the pizzas tasted fantastic.  Everything made from scratch and with really tasty fresh ingredients.  Would happily go back!
